ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were eating almsfood contemptuously, as if not wanting to eat it. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.3.1_0: “‘I will eat almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.4_0: Almsfood is to be eaten respectfully.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, eats almsfood contemptuously, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.6.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.8_0: To give rise to the robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.13_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk31:1.14_0: The first training rule is finished.
